description: I don't know why, but most other tools seem oblivious to the fact that you need four open windows to properly do a 3-way merge (left change, right change, common base, and final merged output). This tool gets it right.
I needed to merge two versions of a 600 line config file and did it quickly with no glitches.
ease of use and appearance
Unusable unfortunately
summary: Still not able to select files in Ubuntu 20.04

description: the best three-way diff available
Can't be used to compare any hidden folders or files, they do not show up in the file picker.

This version of the app (1.8.0) isn't stable, and breaks at least one critical feature - diffing large directories. The app freezes when comparing over 600~800 files. The select file feature in the dialog is also broken, not showing files unhidden files, while the directory select shows these files as unselectable.

The latest version fixed these issues, and I really admire the amount of dedication to the maintenance. Unfortunately, I had to pull and compile the latest code to even use the software properly. The documentation for getting a build up and running is lacking for someone with zero QT experience, which made the process even more frustrating.

I loved the 0.98 version on Windows, and would rate this app 5 stars, with a strong recommendation for anyone dealing with file comparisons. However, this version of the software sorely misses the mark. Update the version distributed by Ubuntu Software, and I will update my rating. Also, please consider adding a dependency installer or a README for an initial build from a clean system to the repository. Manually installing each of the dependencies based on compilation errors was irritating at best; not everyone is a QT developer.
It worked fine with Ubuntu 18.04. Now I have Ubuntu 20.04: it does not work anymore. E.g. It is impossible to select files properly. Useless app for Ubuntu 20.04, I am afraid...
My Favorite Tool, but definitely not working on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. Waht a pitty
summary: Crashes while diffing on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS

description: I'm using this for a years and still it is the best...
I've been using this for years to manage git conflicts. Gets the job done easily.
It;s a nice userfirendly gui on top of diff, and it has a lot of usefull features to comparefiles and even whole directories against each other. A simple tool that I highly recomend.
Worked fine on 16.04 but it fails even when just trying to compare files on Ubuntu 20.04.
Maybe they fixed it since the previous comments
